SEARCH
Package civitas.celestis.math.vector

Class Vector4

java.lang.Object
civitas.celestis.math.vector.Vector4
All Implemented Interfaces:
Vector, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Quaternion, RichColor
public class Vector4 extends Object implements Vector
An immutable four-dimensional vector.
See Also:

    • valueAt

      public final double valueAt(int i) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns the component at the specified index.
      Specified by:
      valueAt in interface Vector
      Parameters:
      i - Index of component to get
      Returns:
      The W, X, Y, Z component for 0, 1, 2, 3 respectively
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - When the index is out of bounds i < 0 || i > 3

    • values

      public final double[] values()
      Returns an array of values which represent the components of this vector. Changes in the return value of this method will not be reflected in the original vector.
      Specified by:

      The array representation of this vector

    • min

      @Nonnull public Vector4 min(@Nonnull Vector v) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns the minimum vector between this vector and the provided vector v. This is achieved by applying Math.min(double, double) to each component of the two vectors.
      Specified by:
      min in interface Vector
      Parameters:
      v - The vector to get the minimum vector of
      Returns:
      The minimum vector of the two vectors
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the provided vector v's length is not 4

    • max

      @Nonnull public Vector4 max(@Nonnull Vector v) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns the maximum vector between this vector and the provided vector v. This is achieved by applying Math.max(double, double) to each component of the two vectors.
      Specified by:
      max in interface Vector
      Parameters:

      Returns:

      Parameters:

      max - The maximum allowed values
      Returns:

    • equals

      public boolean equals(@Nullable Object obj)
      Checks for equality between this vector and given object. This operation ensures that the equality operator will work reliably between different instances of Vector.
      Specified by:
      equals in interface Vector
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to compare to
      Returns:
      true if the given object is an instance of Vector, and the components and length are equal

      Returns:

      Throws:
